message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.NE 

This paper deals with the problem of detecting zero-day attacks on the control processor of a power-grid system. This problem falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The proposed solution involves training a deep learning model to detect anomalous behavior in the power-grid controller, which involves the use of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The power-grid system is a complex system that involves control and monitoring of physical processes, which falls under the category of control systems (cs.SY). Finally, the proposed solution involves the use of statistical tests to estimate deviations from normal behavior, which involves the use of statistical methods (cs.NE).
